definition: to return home
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
(coll.) (Tw) to get sacked/to be fired

sentences.chinese: 這些勞累的孩子直到7點纔回家。

sentences.english: Boy stole a lesson-book from one of his school-fellows and took it home to his Mother.
sentences.chinese: 有個男孩偷了同學的一本教科書，帶回家給母親。

sentences.english: Red back home, light fire make life.
sentences.chinese: 紅色跟着回家，人間煙火。

sentences.english: It was fine at first; most of my friends had moved home too.
sentences.chinese: 起初我覺得還好，我的很多朋友也都回家投靠父母了。

sentences.english: Doudou has been home half a month, how I miss him.
sentences.chinese: 豆豆回家已經半個月了，我好想他啊。

sentences.english: Gastrointestinal disorders big investigation, the health to take home.
sentences.chinese: 胃腸道疾病大排查，把健康帶回家。

sentences.english: My elder brother and I loaded the handcart with wheat and pulled it home.
sentences.chinese: 我和哥哥用架子車裝了一車麥子拉回家。

sentences.english: Walking home by the alma mater is just for seeking fun.
sentences.chinese: 經過母校步行回家僅僅爲了取樂而已。

sentences.english: He likes a drink when he returns home from work.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡放工回家後喝一杯酒。

sentences.english: I would recite all that had been rehearsed on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 我會把在回家路上練習過的東西背誦一遍。

sentences.english: Glass and a Half Full Productions, home of Cadbury Dairy Milk, the gorilla and trucks.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃和半飽製作，吉百利牛奶，大猩猩和卡車回家。

sentences.english: She then took the chicken bones home and made soup out of them.
sentences.chinese: 然後她把雞骨頭打包回家，做成了湯。

sentences.english: As she drove home, Mrs. Cox thought about the class she had just left.
sentences.chinese: 科克斯夫人在驅車回家的路上想着她剛上完的這節課。

sentences.english: Now the lifeguards have all gone home.
sentences.chinese: 現在救生員全都回家了。

sentences.english: Think of the long trip home.

definition: to return/to go back
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to return/to come back
perfect/excellent/brought to the utmost degree
to finish work/to get off work
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
native place/place of origin/home state or region
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
(of a wife) to return to her parental home/(fig.) to return to one's old place, job, school etc
to go out
to dismiss students at the end of the school day
dad and mom
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
home
to go to school/to attend school

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
